data.title: States Pop Quiz #2: Wiz Khalifa
data.meta_description: The superstar rapper chats American dreaming, Marvin Gaye and why he spends the odd night in jail
data.text:
What is your favorite quote about America?

Wiz Khalifa: I’m not sure I have one...

What three words define the States today?

Wiz Khalifa: I don’t know.

Which living American do you most admire and why?

Wiz Khalifa: I just admire anybody who’s working and doesn’t have everything right there in front of them, but is making their own way. Those are the people I respect and admire in America.

Which living American do you most despise and why?

Wiz Khalifa: I don’t despise anybody.

Who gave you your first break? Do you still talk?

Wiz Khalifa: Nobody gave me my first big break.

When and where are you the most happiest?

Wiz Khalifa: I’m the most happiest when I’m with my son or when I’m in the studio just creating and vibing...coming up with new ideas.

What high school clique were you in? Do you stay in touch?

Wiz Khalifa: "Weirdo clique". Yeah I still talk to them.

What food reminds you of home?

Wiz Khalifa: Well there’s certain food that you can only get at home, and then there’s the food that reminds me of home. I would probably say like a gyro.

What smell do you associate with the city of your birth?

Wiz Khalifa: I don’t remember the city of my birth that much. I wasn’t born in Pittsburgh, but a smell that reminds me of the city of Pittsburgh is the smell of rivers.

What's the best road trip you've ever been on?

Wiz Khalifa: Probably camping with my parents.

Where did you lose your virginity?

Wiz Khalifa: In my teens. In a bed.

What would make you leave America forever?

Wiz Khalifa: If we were threatened by war. Like if they said, "We’re gonna take over your whole country,” I would just get out and go to Australia or something.

What noise reminds you of the States?

Wiz Khalifa: People laughing.

What is your favorite American building?

Wiz Khalifa: The Rock n’ Roll Hall Of Fame!

Ultimate American film?

Wiz Khalifa: Pulp Fiction.
